channel.title: Problem loading Source games in general. Help?
channel.description:
Okay so this kinda has nothing to do with Black Mesa but at the same time it does. I haven't been able to start this game since its initial download and I've spent about nine or so hours installing, uninstalling, and reinstalling BMS today. Every time I attempt to start it I get a "Preparing to Launch Black Mesa..." message, the cursor spins a little and then nothing happens.
At first I thought it was something wrong with the mod in and of itself. Out of curiosity however, I checked to see if it was really the mod and not my system. Turns out [u][b]none[/b][/u] of my source engine games will get past the "Preparing to load _______..." command box. Now after scouring both the Steam, Windows 7, and other forums I really cannot find anything to help my case. So, in essence, what do I do next? Do I reinstall steam altogether? Should I delete some obscurely named executable/registry key/.ini etc. What do I do next?
Edit: Also I realize that it launches hl2.exe*32 briefly as a process but shuts it down less than 2 seconds later. Could this be because I'm running this on a 64 bit system?

item.dc:creator: shepters
item.description:
The “-novid” option doesn’t work for me but the dll in that update cab does (even though it has a few funny effects while the game is loading).
What to do:

  1. Download the 64 bit version from Skitch’s MS link. Don’t open it, just save it. (The 64 bit version also contains the 32 bit versions). The 64 bit dll version in this update doesn’t work for me either.
    Direct link - https://download.microsoft.com/download/9/6/3/963B01D2-97C2-416B-B97A-38BF39E8B763/Windows6.0-KB939130-x64.msu
  2. Use Skitch’s example script to extract it.
  3. Copy the DLL from one of the x86 folders and paste it where I described in my earlier post.

You should be able to find an old (but legal) version here:
https://support.microsoft.com/kb/939130
I wouldn’t install it. Just extract all the files and get the dll you need. The commands (I didn’t try them) should be something like:

expand -F:* update.msu C:\<target_dir>
cd <target_dir>
expand -F:* update.cab C:\<target_dir>

But on second thought, since you’re trying to replace a dll to handle .avi files… Did you try the “-novid” option?

Also, did you try starting the “Source SDK 2007 Base” video stress? (in Steam, Library->Tools->Source SDK 2007 Base->Play Game.) Does it work?

item.title: Problem loading Source games in general. Help?
item.dc:creator: shepters
item.description:
Am running W7 64 and have been having problems with steam games. As others have said, steam runs, maybe shows an advert and then nothing else happens. This first happened with Portal 2 and now with Black Mesa (BM) but I found a solution.
If you try to run the game exe in the steam folder it reports a bad dll “windows/system32/ avifil32.dl”. Mine is 106KB. My Son has W7 32 90KB and BM works there. So I dropped his dll next to the game exe in my steam folder and it worked.
The idea here is that when an exe loads a dll it looks for it first (if a path is not included in the call) in the exe folder then in the system/registered paths. So the dll is only used for the specific game that needs it and not the whole system.
I have no idea what’s causing this problem but this worked for me. BM exe is called hl2.exe and is located in “Steam folder”\SteamApps"Your Steam ID"\source sdk base 2007.
